node.title: How to express the x coordinate of the qp point in Kernel ?

node.bodyText:
_q_point is the array of the qps. So it needs to be double indexed into
_q_point[qp](0)

node.title: PorousFlowUnsaturated dummy question
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I have a simple aquitard-aquifer system with a well in the aquifer that de-saturates the medium. I have made two models one with actions and the other one using kernels. However, I am not getting the same level of saturation at the end of the simulation. Could you please give a hint of what I am doing wrong. Also why the saturation in PorousFlosUnsaturated action is an element variable and with kernels is at the nodes?
Code:
https://github.com/wangshengwa/PorousFlow-stuff
Thanks!
Wang

Hi @wangshengwa , i'm on holiday so I'm sorry that i can't explore your input files in detail.  I had a quick look and don't see anything obviously different between them.  As for the element-vs-node difference: the saturation is always computed by PorousFlow at the nodes (no matter whether you use an Action or Kernels), however, your PorousFlowPropertyAux (note, you correctly used a "constant monomial" saturation variable) will use just one of the nodal values for each element.  Hence, it really only provides an approximate view of the representation held internally by PorousFlow (remember that the finite element solution is only accurate up to the size of the finite element, so this approximation is never too bad).   Perhaps this answers your question (ie, perhaps you were comparing nodal values to elemental values)?

I understand now. Thanks a lot, this solves my question.
Wang

node.title: The material can't be defined on the boundary in 1D mesh
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
Recently I was trying using 1D mesh in MOOSE. In the test case I defined a material on a boundary but to cause an error "the material object contains the following boundary ids that do not exist on the mesh". However, the boundary can be recognized in the BC. The 1D mesh file is generated using Gmsh. The input file is:
[Mesh]
  type = FileMesh
  file = 1d_mesh_test.msh
[]

[Variables]
  [./u]
  [../]
[]

[Kernels]
  [./diff]
    type = Diffusion
    variable = u
    block = '11 12'
  [../]
[]

[BCs]
  [./left_left]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = u
    boundary = 7
    value = 1
  [../]
  [./left_right]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = u
    boundary = 8
    value = 0
  [../]
  [./right_left]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = u
    boundary = 9
    value = 1
  [../]
  [./right_right]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = u
    boundary = 10
    value = 0
  [../]
[]

[Materials]
  [mat]
    type = GenericConstantMaterial
    prop_names = 'm'
    prop_values = 1.0
    boundary = 8
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Steady
  solve_type = 'PJFNK'
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'hypre boomeramg'
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
[]

The Gmsh geometry file is:
Point(1) = {0, 0.0, 0};
Point(2) = {0.0026, 0.0, 0};
Point(3) = {0.0027, 0, 0};
Point(4) = {0.003, 0, 0};

$EndMeshFormat

Hi GiudGiud,
Actually this is just a test case. What I really need is to apply the thermal contact in HeatConduction module to this 1D mesh. The thermal contact restricts the materials to the gap boundaries so I have to solve this issue.

Open the Mesh in paraview (you can use —mesh-only and exodus output in moose for that)
And look at the id or name of the side set
Looking at the gmsh file I m not sure it exists?

I opened the output file in Paraview:

it seems that the boundaries of the 1D mesh can only be recognized as nodesets but not sidesets. It seems reasonable because the boundary only has one node in 1D mesh.
I also read the code of BoundaryRestrictable, on which the Material is based:

The _bnd_nodal in Material is false so the Material can not be restricted to nodesets. Maybe I could set the _bnd_nodal in Material to be true to solve this issue?

I can see that.
Is your target case 1D as well?
You mean setting the dim = 1 in [Mesh]? I did this but the error still existed ...
What version of paraview  are you using? Are you using the legacy exodus reader?

Paraview 4.4 is definitely very old, they are at 11 now.
If you upgrade to 11 or 10, you will have to make sure to select the Legacy Exodus reader
Is your final case (the one you are making this test case for) also 1D ?

node.title: RenormalizeVector UserObject
node.bodyText:
I have what is probably a question that is easily answered. I am using the UO NormalizeVector that was kindly provided to renormalize a vector field that has to have unit norm. I execute on "timestep_end" (any other option like linear or nonlinear does not work iterations diverge right away)). When I dump data after simulations, there are typically some isolated nodes (using exodus output and paraview) on which the norm deviates somewhat from unity, sometimes up to 2. My question is: does RenormalizeVector renormalize on elements or on nodes? If it normalizes on elements I can understand that the value on nodes can deviate from unity, but if it normalizes on nodes the norm should be unity on all nodes at output (as the normalization is at timestep_end). Or am I misunderstanding something (not at all unlikely....)?
Cheers,
Olle

Hello
I dont know this user object. Is it in MOOSE? Could you please send me a link to the source if not.
It could be a NodalUO or an ElementalUO, I dont know.
This renormalization on every time step, is it supposed to be conserving something?
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume,

I think Daniel Schwen wrote it at our request for ferret. The UO is in the
main branch of moose. We use it in micromagnetic simulations as the norm of
the magnetization director has to be conserved.
…
-Olle

node.title: Phase field modeling
node.bodyText:
Hai all,
I have to develop the multiphase field model. I want to extend that model to a polycrystalline one.
1). I don't have grain growth for one grain i.e. my grain boundaries don't move for one specific grain, but my remaining grains will grow. Is there any example that I can use as an initial step?
2). how to couple elastic behavior with this
can you please provide some solutions for this

Hello
Please see the documentation for the phase field module. https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/phase_field/index.html
The capabilities we have for 1) should be in the grain growth section
For 2), see the elastic driving force for grain growth section section
Guillaume

Thank you for your response
…
On Sun, 25 Sep, 2022, 12:48 pm Guillaume Giudicelli, < ***@***.***> wrote:
 Hello

 Please see the documentation for the phase field module.
 https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/phase_field/index.html
 The capabilities we have for 1) should be in the grain growth section
 For 2), see the elastic driving force for grain growth section section

 Guillaume

node.title: 1 failed tests of 469 header files
node.bodyText:
Hi.
I was trying to build libmesh manually. But when I finally ran make installcheck, one test failed. So will this affect the results?
Testing Header solvers/petscdmlibmesh.h ...                     [ FAILED ]

Hello
We dont use the PETSc DM by default in moose or libmesh so no it wont.
Any reason you are installing libmesh manually instead of using conda or using the scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh?
Guillaume

I'm trying to install Cardinal，but there is some incompatibility with the moose‘s conda environment.
So I should build  PETSc and libMesh under base environment. But when I ran ./contrib/moose/scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh，the errors appeared at the beginning.

which errors did you get?
Did you install PETSc first?

Yes, I have built PETSc successfully.
I don't understand that error, please wait for me to recompile and reply to you.

Sorry，I'm late.
The errors I can see when I ran './contrib/moose/scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh'


The full output is shown in the following file.
output.txt

These prompt codes can run smoothly
--disable-netcdf-4  --disable-dap
Now libmesh seems to have been successfully installed.
Thank you for your answering.
Zhang

It seems you need to install this z library or zlib on your machine to build netcdf4 (related to exodus output)
Do you have admin access on this machine?
PS:
Please avoid screenshots, they are not searchable by others. And harder to read on some devices.

You are right. There is still something wrong with libmesh.
And I have admin access. Should I run sudo ./contrib/moose/scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh instead ？
When I intended to install Cardinal directly , the following error came up.
Compiling C++ (in opt mode) /home/en/cardinal/contrib/moose/framework/build/unity_src/timeintegrators_Unity.C...
In file included from /home/en/cardinal/contrib/moose/framework/build/unity_src/outputs_formatters_Unity.C:2:
/home/en/cardinal/contrib/moose/framework/src/outputs/formatters/ExodusFormatter.C:17:10: fatal error: libmesh/exodusII.h: No such file or directory
   17 | #include "libmesh/exodusII.h"
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
No you should install zlib then try to install libmesh again
Okay，thank you ，I'm on it.

Exactly as you said, the executable has been built successfully by doing so!
Thanks again for your valuable guidance!

node.title: CoupledVarThesholdNodalBCModifier type system exists?
node.bodyText: I have a mesh with values at the nodes of 0 or 1. If the indicator value is 1, I want to apply a DirichletBC to that node and for the rest of the nodes, I just want to solve some other physics. The indicator field will change every timestep, and can't be determined beforehand. Can someone point me to some code that shows the changing of node sets based on a value or something that could perform the action above? Thank you!
You can follow the element subdomain modifier code. IIRC modifying the nodeset was actually the easy part of all. You'd modify the boundary info and call meshChanged to reinit the equation system.
I thought there was some nodeset modifying code in a PR somewhere. I’ll check when I get back
Let me know if you find it. I created my own that works for my application but will probably need some changes to be general purpose enough to add into MOOSE.

Looking at recent activity on this, #21579, seems we do not have this
We're definitely interested if you have something working

node.title: Linear iteration residual
node.bodyText: Hello, I am wondering what the residual function of the linear iteration is at each nonlinear iteration. Is it dx*J+R, where dx is the solution update, J is the Jacobian, and R is the nonlinear residual? Also, when using Newton as the solver_type, usually only one linear iteration is needed, but sometimes there are more than one linear iterations. Is that an indication of a wrong Jacobian in the kernels?

For your first question, almost -- it is preconditioned.
For your second question,  if you use a direct solver, usually only one linear iteration is needed, unless the matrix isn't well conditioned. If you use an iterative solver, then you need more than one linear iteration in general.
In short, if you use Newton + a direct solver + a full preconditioning matrix, more than one linear iteration is indeed an indication of either

inaccurate Jacobian
a poorly conditioned system
Note there s a Python utility in moose (jacobian_analyzer) you may use to check your jacobian if you suspect it has issues
Also residual is scaled if you use manual or automatic scaling
Yes I have used the Jacobian debugger before, thanks for pointing it out!

node.title: The difference between _array_grad_test and _grad_test

node.bodyText:
_array_grad_test is only for array variables.
_grad_test is for regular field variables.

node.title: Working of older version of moose
node.bodyText:
I am running a code of 2018 but that is not converging now. So, I want to run an older version of moose of april 2018 to reproduce the results. I followed these steps in order to install the older version:
conda create -n test moose-mpich
conda activate test
cd projects
cd moose
git checkout e1abc87f1b8ca4a7b8ba0b2fd9f803fb2ee31c8     #moose version
I checked the moose folder and saw that the update_and_rebuild_petsc.sh and many other files are missing. Where can I have gone wrong?
On reading the documentation and the forum, 2 more commands has to be run
./scripts/update_and_rebuild_petsc.sh
./scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh
but this cannot be run unless I have the update_and_rebuild_petsc.sh file.

Hello
In 2018 we probably did not have these scripts. That was 4 years ago. In fact the petsc script is from December 2018
You ll have to take these steps manually
OR
you can pull newer versions of the scripts. libmesh and petsc should be fairly backwards compatible
Guillaume
